decks.notes: This Jeskai control deck focuses on maintaining board control through a combination of removal spells and counter spells, while also generating card advantage with card draw spells like Jeskai Revelation and Stock Up. The deck also includes a mix of creatures with abilities that can help control the board like Marang River Regent and Shiko, Paragon of the Way. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana needed for the deck's spells, with a focus on flexibility and utility lands like Riverpyre Verge and Sunbillow Verge.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing cards like Vivi Ornitier and Marauding Mako to put pressure on the opponent. The key strategy involves efficiently managing resources and controlling the board with spells like Torch the Tower and Abrade, while also utilizing cards like Riverpyre Verge and Multiversal Passage to ensure consistent land drops. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and direct damage spells, all while maintaining card advantage through cards like Prof's Eidetic Memory and Agatha's Soul Cauldron.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive creatures and utilizing the Simic color combination to adapt to different situations. By playing efficient creatures like Jackal, Genius Geneticist and Floodpits Drowner, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early on. The inclusion of cards like Multiversal Passage and Gene Pollinator allows for flexibility and adaptability in combat. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and dynamic aggro playstyle while utilizing the synergy of the Simic colors to maintain control of the board.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to slow down the opponent's game plan with cards like Consult the Star Charts, Get Lost, and No More Lies, while controlling the board with Day of Judgment and counterspells like Essence Scatter. The deck also focuses on card advantage with Meticulous Archive and stocking up resources with cards like Stock Up. Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Ugin, Eye of the Storms provide win conditions, while Rest in Peace and Beza, the Bounding Spring help disrupt graveyard strategies. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize efficient creatures and spells to pressure the opponent early on in the game, while also having disruptive elements to control the board and protect your own creatures. By utilizing a combination of flying creatures, removal spells, and card draw, this deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. With a focus on tempo and aggression, this deck seeks to win the game through consistent pressure and strategic decision-making.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By effectively controlling the board with counter spells and removal, while also applying pressure with evasive threats, the deck aims to establish board dominance and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck also includes card draw and recursion to maintain momentum and ensure a consistent stream of threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficient use of resources and tactical play to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage quickly and efficiently. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Burnout Bashtronaut and Nova Hellkite, along with direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning to control the board and finish off the opponent. The deck is designed to maintain a high level of pressure on the opponent, making it difficult for them to stabilize and turn the game in their favor.

The key idea behind this deck is to quickly establish board control and deal direct damage to the opponent through aggressive plays and efficient removal spells. By utilizing a mix of versatile creatures with powerful abilities, along with burn spells and card draw, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while constantly replenishing resources. The combination of cheap spells and mana-efficient creatures allows for fast-paced gameplay and the potential to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Additionally, the deck includes various ways to trigger additional effects and synergies to further enhance its aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, with a combination of low-cost creatures and powerful instant/sorcery spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to continuously apply pressure with evasive creatures like Stormchaser's Talent and Marauding Mako, while using spells like Torch the Tower and Into the Flood Maw to clear the way and deal direct damage. Additionally, the deck has card advantage and mana fixing options to maintain momentum and outpace the opponent. The goal is to win the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to efficiently use cards like Lightning Strike, Burst Lightning, and Emberheart Challenger to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. By maintaining a high tempo and pressuring the opponent early on with fast creatures like Nova Hellkite and Hired Claw, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Additionally, cards like Soulstone Sanctuary and Rockface Village provide additional ways to maintain card advantage and fuel the aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing cards like Steamcore Scholar, Marauding Mako, and Vivi Ornitier to put pressure on opponents early. Winternight Stories helps to draw into more threats, while cards like Quantum Riddler and Proft's Eidetic Memory provide additional card advantage. The deck also includes removal options like Abrade and Torch the Tower to deal with any potential threats from the opponent. Multiversal Passage and Riverpyre Verge help with mana fixing, while Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Fear of Missing Out provide additional ways to close out games quickly.

The main idea of this deck is to aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and mana acceleration. By utilizing cards that generate additional resources and efficient creatures like Azure Beastbinder and Floodpits Drowner, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and control elements to maintain momentum and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The synergy between cards like Gene Pollinator and Jackal, Genius Geneticist further enhances the deck's ability to rapidly close out games.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to play aggressively and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and burn spells. Key cards like Marauding Mako and Stormchaser's Talent help to apply pressure early on, while cards like Fear of Missing Out and Torch the Tower provide reach to finish off the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and card advantage engines like Proft's Eidetic Memory and Quantum Riddler to help maintain momentum throughout the game. The mana base of the deck ensures consistent access to both red and blue spells.

The Simic Aggro deck focuses on using powerful creatures with abilities that synergize well together to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Gene Pollinator and Ouroboroid, the deck aims to create a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. Utilizing abilities like Azure Beastbinder's token generation and Tyvar, the Pummeler's pump ability, the deck can quickly build up a threatening board state. The inclusion of cards like Spyglass Siren and Multiversal Passage also provides disruption and evasion to ensure the deck can push through for the win.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful instant spells. Using cards like Into the Flood Maw and Winternight Stories to deal damage efficiently, while also leveraging the versatility of cards like Abrade and Torch the Tower for removal. The deck also includes card draw and mana ramp options with cards like Profet's Eidetic Memory and Multiversal Passage, ensuring that the player can maintain a steady stream of threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and tempo to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through card advantage, removal spells, and counterspells. The deck aims to stall the game with cards like Consult the Star Charts and Stock Up, while using cards like Three Steps Ahead and Beza, the Bounding Spring to control the board. It also includes powerful finishers like Ultima and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to close out the game. The deck focuses on efficient removal and countermagic to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ultimately win through attrition and superior resource management.
